column2: TELL ME ABOUT HEALTHY SLEEP HABITS
column5: Healthy sleep habits#Comma also known as sleep hygiene#Comma are essential for quality rest. Maintain a consistent sleep schedule by going to bed and waking up at the same times each day. Create a relaxing bedtime routine#Comma avoid caffeine and screens before bed#Comma and keep your sleep environment comfortable and dark.

If you're struggling with insomnia#Comma establishing a bedtime routine is crucial. Wind down with calming activities#Comma such as reading or gentle stretches. Limit exposure to bright screens#Comma and consider practicing relaxation techniques like deep breathing before sleep.

Improving sleep quality involves creating a conducive sleep environment. Keep your bedroom dark#Comma quiet#Comma and at a comfortable temperature. Avoid heavy meals and alcohol close to bedtime. By prioritizing sleep#Comma you'll reap the benefits of improved energy and focus during the day.

Nighttime anxiety can disrupt sleep. Create a relaxation routine before bed#Comma such as reading#Comma listening to soothing music#Comma or practicing mindfulness. Keep a notepad by your bedside to jot down worries if they arise#Comma allowing you to address them the next day.
